en.pressContinue: Press the next button to continue.
en.questionOneText: This bag has 4 Red, 5 blue, 3 Yellow and 3 Green marbles. What is the theoretical probability of drawing each marble if we put the marble back in the bag each time?
en.questionOneCompleted_1:
Great work! Those are the correct probabilities.
Now lets see the experimental probability (Exp Prob) of drawing out each marble.
en.questionTwoStarted: On this screen you can draw out the marbles. Try it a few times by pressing the Draw button.
en.questionTwoExplain_1: This screen shows the Theoretical (Theo Prob)and Experimental probabilities (Exp Prob) of drawing out the marbles.
en.questionTwoExplain_2: Try drawing out some more marbles and see how Exp Prob changes every time a marble is drawn.
en.questionTwoExplain_3: Based on past experience, we can make reasonable estimates of the likelihood of future events. This is called Experimental Probability.
en.questionTwoExplain_4: Try drawing out 25 marbles and answer the question that then appears below.
en.questionTwoDropDownCaption: What can you say about the Experimental Probabilities?
en.questionTwoDropDownOption_1: The Exp Prob is not similar to the Theo Prob
en.questionTwoDropDownOption_2: The Exp Prob is somewhat similar to Theo Prob
en.questionTwoDropDownOption_3: The Exp Prob is close to Theo Prob
en.questionTwoExplain_5: Try drawing out 50 marbles and answer the question that then appears below.
en.questionTwoExplain_6: Try drawing out a 100 marbles and answer the question that then appears below.
en.questionTwoExplain_7: As the number of experiments increases the Experimental Probability gets closer to the Theoretical Probability
en.questionTwoExplain_8: Try drawing out 150 marbles and answer the question that then appears below.
en.questionTwoExplain_9: Try drawing out 200 marbles and answer the question that then appears below.
en.questionTwoExplain_10: Answer the question by selecting the most appropriate option from the drop down below and pressing the Okay Button
en.questionThreeIntro_1: In this section you have two bags. You don't know how many red and blue marbles are in each bag.
en.questionThreeIntro_2: Draw a 100 marbles from each bag and answer the questions that appear below.
en.questionThreeQuestion_1: Which bag do you think has an equal number of red and blue marbles?
en.questionThreeQuestion_2: Which bag do you think has more blue marbles?
en.questionThree_Draw_from_Other: You have drawn a 100 marbles from one bag already. Draw a 100 from the other too.
en.you_are_correct_1: That's correct. The first bag has 7 blue marbles and 3 red marbles as shown by the Experimental Probabilities
en.you_are_wrong_1: That's incorrect. The first bag has 7 blue marbles and 3 red marbles as shown by the Experimental Probabilities
en.you_are_correct_2: That's correct. The second bag has an equal number of red and blue marbles.
en.you_are_wrong_2: That's incorrect. The second bag has an equal number of red and blue marbles.
en.congratulations_finished: Congratulations, you have finished the main part of the game.
en.next_steps: You can now go to the main menu and explore the other unlocked modes.
